description: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' has crossed the Rs 100 crore worldwide mark in its first week, despite a slight dip on Day 7. The romantic drama delivered a strong opening and steady weekdays, becoming Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit. However, its box office run faces a major challenge with the release of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' this weekend.

title: Arsenal extend Premier League lead, Chelsea beaten at Leeds
description: Liverpool needed a late Nordi Mukiele own-goal to avoid another damaging defeat at home in a 1-1 draw with Sunderland, while Aston Villa climbed up to third after a 4-3 victory at Brighton.

title: 80 Padma awardee doctors ring alarm over threat from airborne microplastics
Enduring symbol of a lasting bond between great music and fine food
description: ‘Madurai’ Mani Iyer lived in a house for 10 years in Mayiladuthurai after leaving Madras in 1939 following the evacuation during the Second World War. After returning to Madras in 1955, he sold the house to Agoram Iyer, a celebrated cook, rejecting a higher bid

title: Jawaharlal Nehru’s language of optimism and equality at the Madras Corporation
description: Aware that language was a politically sensitive issue in Tamil Nadu, the Prime Minister gave a promise in a speech in 1963 that “any idea that any one language can dominate over others or, what is called linguistic imperialism, is totally unrealistic”. He also rejected the notion that one language would hamper the growth of the other language

title: A fort in the midst of a forest was a secret training ground for cavalry and elephants
description: In the early 1700s, King Chellamuthu  Vijayaragunatha  Sethupathy was gifted 200 horses by a Muslim businessman from Thondi. He built a fort in a dense tropical thorn forest, about 70 km from Ramanathapuram. Here, Sankarapathi, one of Hyder  Ali’s commandants, trained these horses. Impressed by the tutelage, the king named the fort after him

title: Activists flag groundwater contamination to Delhi L-G & CM
IndiGo meltdown hits flyers: Mumbai City FC stranded 10 hours; fares spike, chaos nationwide
description: A nationwide air travel crisis, primarily involving IndiGo, has left thousands stranded.  Mumbai City FC's journey to a Super Cup semi-final was severely impacted by cancellations and delays. Passengers faced prolonged waits, exorbitant fares, and missed crucial events, highlighting widespread disruption across major Indian cities.

title: Sevilla stadium partially closed after fans throw objects in derby

description: The Bombay High Court has made a landmark decision by granting bail to Hany Babu, a former Delhi University professor linked to the Elgar Parishad case, after a staggering five-year incarceration. The court underscored that holding someone without trial for such an extended period breaches essential rights.

title: Zepto delivery man rescues kids dumped in Noida drain by their mother’s partner
IndiNoGo chaos: 300 flights cancelled nationwide; airline admits crew miscalculation
description: Thousands of passengers faced severe travel chaos as IndiGo cancelled around 300 flights on Thursday due to underestimating pilot needs under new duty rules. This planning lapse by the airline led to widespread airport disruptions, impacting even other carriers. IndiGo admitted to misjudging crew requirements, causing significant inconvenience.

description: Trinamool Congress has suspended MLA Humayun Kabir for his controversial plan to lay the foundation of a mosque on December 6, the anniversary of the Babri Masjid demolition.  Despite the party's action, Kabir remains defiant, vowing to proceed with the plan and launch his own political party.  Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee emphasized unity, stating that disruptive elements would be removed.

description: India witnessed a grim rise in road fatalities in 2024, with 1.77 lakh deaths, averaging 485 daily. While National Highways showed a slight decrease in their share of accidents, overall deaths climbed 2.3% from the previous year. Experts emphasize the need for education and broader awareness campaigns to combat this crisis.

Discussions included S-400 systems, Sukhoi upgrades, and BrahMos missile advancements, underscoring a commitment to bolstering India's indigenous defense capabilities and maintaining a strong partnership with Moscow.

A five-layer security grid, combining Russian and Indian elite forces, ensures his safety, with snipers and anti-drone systems deployed.

Live-in relationships are not illegal, and the state must ensure protection.

Fans have renewed hope with Prescott leading the team. Trevon Diggs and Tyler Guyton are out due to injury.

title: Arrested suspect in Rubaiya abduction was 'inadvertently' named in CBI warrant: Court
description: A TADA court quashed a warrant against Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, arrested as an accomplice in the 1989 Rubaiya Sayeed abduction. The court found Shangloo was "inadvertently" named, as he was listed in the 1991 chargesheet as "released for want of evidence," not an "absconding accused." Warrants against seven others were also cancelled.

Gujarat HC halts Rs 45L alimony order: Wife accused of killing mother-in-law
description: The Gujarat High Court has temporarily halted a Rs 45 lakh alimony order for a woman accused of murdering her mother-in-law. Her estranged husband challenged the payment, citing the grave nature of the crime. The court acknowledged the serious allegations, including the husband's claim of cruelty, and will hear the case further in January.

title: J&K Police bust Pak-linked narco-terror syndicate; 6 held with 5kg heroin, 3 pistols
description: Jammu Police have dismantled a cross-border narco-terror network, arresting six individuals and seizing 5kg of heroin worth over Rs 30 crore, along with arms. Investigations revealed connections to Pakistani handlers fueling anti-India activities. The operation, initiated by suspicious pedestrians, led to the unravelling of a sophisticated drug and arms supply chain.

title: Zuckerberg to cut budget by billions for the project FB owner changed its name
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly planning significant resource cuts, potentially as high as 30%, for its metaverse division, including virtual worlds and VR units. This comes as the company shifts its focus towards artificial intelligence development, with budget reductions expected to impact the VR group and potentially lead to layoffs early next year.

Rupee slumps: What the currency’s fall beyond 90 per dollar means for investors
description: The Indian rupee has breached Rs 90 against the US dollar for the first time, driven by weak capital flows, importer demand, and trade deal uncertainty. This decline has impacted equity markets, prompting foreign investor selling despite strong domestic fundamentals. Analysts warn of further depreciation if the rupee sustains above this psychological barrier.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar gets eliminated; refuses to forgive Amaal Mallik
description: Bigg Boss 19's grand finale is set for December 7, with the Top 5 finalists now revealed. Malti Chahar was the latest contestant eliminated after a 'Magical Kadhai' challenge, leaving Farrhana Bhatt as the fifth finalist. Malti departed without forgiving Pranit More, citing his behavior throughout the season.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
description: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Gastroenterologist shares 4 signs of colon cancer in the 30s
description: America faces a silent health crisis with rising colorectal cancer rates, particularly concerning among young adults. Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab highlights four key warning signs: unexplained fatigue due to anemia, night sweats from inflammatory proteins, persistent changes in bowel habits like constipation or diarrhea, and blood in stool, a potential hallmark of the disease. Read below to know more!

title: US vs China: Ford CEO warns; We are in deep trouble because the US lacks skilled labour
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical shortage of skilled tradespeople in the US, highlighting over a million empty positions in essential sectors. He contrasts the US unfavorably with China, emphasizing the need for investment in trade education and a cultural shift to value manual labor to rebuild the nation's workforce and ensure national security.
